interestingFact: India is home to the world’s largest postal network with over 150,000 post offices.
Japan has more than 1,500 earthquakes every year due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire.
Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than humans.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, the only remaining Wonder of the Ancient World.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world, stretching over 21,000 kilometers.
South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria (administrative), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).
Mexico City is sinking at a rate of 10 inches per year due to its foundation on a former lakebed.
